end.title: Raumlichtkunst
end.credit_line:
Oskar Fischinger

Three-screen installation

Reconstruction by Center for Visual Music, USA
end.brief_description: Oskar Fischinger’s Raumlichtkunst is one of the first multimedia projections ever made. Using film projectors, colour filters and slides, Fischinger staged multi-screen film events that were first shown in Germany around 1926 and reconstructed by the Center for Visual Music (CVM) in Los Angeles.

constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

links.description: Oskar Fischinger staged some of the very first multi-media performances in history. Raumlichtkunst, a reconstruction of his multiple-screen film events, first shown in Germany in 1926, was restored by the Center for Visual Music (CVM) in Los Angeles and shows in Gallery 2.

links.description: Just as Taree McKenzie explores colour in abstraction, Walter Ruttman’s Lichtspiel Opus I also uses colour without reference to any representational imagery. This was the first abstract film to be publicly screened.

end.title: Hue
end.brief_description:
Hue is a stark puzzle platformer where you shift the hue of the world, creating rifts when colours collide.

In this world, everyone sees in grayscale. Anne, a researcher specialising in colour theory, has created a mysterious ring which grants the ability to perceive and alter colour. After a fracas with her research assistant, she disappears into a coloured void. You play as Hue, Anne’s son, as he discovers fragments of his missing mother’s research and learns to perceive and alter colour for the first time.

constellations_other.name: Colour and illusion
constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

links.description: This focus on colour as something with its own character and magical qualities inspired the videogame Hue where a grayscale world becomes transformed through the discovery of colour and its capacity for transformation.

start.brief_description: Space Invaders is an arcade video game developed by Tomohiro Nishikado and released in 1978. It is one of the earliest shooting games and the aim is to defeat waves of aliens with a laser cannon to earn as many points as possible.

end.title: Home Alone
end.brief_description: Eight-year-old Kevin McCallister makes the most of the situation after his family unwittingly leaves him behind when they go on Christmas vacation. But when a pair of bungling burglars set their sights on Kevin’s house, the plucky kid stands ready to defend his territory. By planting booby traps galore, adorably mischievous Kevin stands his ground as his frantic mother attempts to race home before Christmas Day.

constellations_other.description: Exploring the science of colour, light, reflection and movement.

constellations_other.name: Neo-noir
constellations_other.description: Blade Runner's retro-futurist setting lends it a timeless quality, while also connecting it to the past and the future.

constellations_other.name: Houses that move us
constellations_other.description: Our homes are important to us. When they’re good, they’re our havens. If that home changes, or things go wrong, it can affect us very deeply. This constellation looks at the different ways directors and game devs have positioned the home onscreen - from sanctuary, to hostile enemy.

recommendations.quote: This legendary Christmas film penned by John Hughes is one of the most quotable films in history. But it's not just a screwball kid's comedy about Kevin overcoming his fears, it's equally about maternal devotion and Catherine O'Hara's Kate McAllister quest to reunite with her son.

links.description: This simple adaptation of the game console to produce an unearthly effect can be compared to the use of reflective glass as a practical effect in Home Alone to create the illusion that Harry’s head has been set alight.

links.description: Taree Mackenzie uses a ‘Pepper’s ghost’ technique that employs light, reflection and glass to create a seemingly three-dimensional sculpture. This reflective technique is used in the original Space Invaders console to make the graphics appear against an illuminated moon backdrop.
